description.narrative: SWAPNO is gender based social security project targeting ultra-poor rural women implemented by the Local Government Division and United Nations Development Programme under the auspices of National Social Security Strategy.

activity-description.narrative: Dhaka Project Management Unit, Department of Public Health Kakrail, Dhaka

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
1.1: Number of SWAPNO beneficiaries employed in public asset maintenance work and earning regular income. 1.2: % of SWAPNO beneficiaries’ engaged in Income Generating Activities (IGAs) other than public work 1.3: Number of beneficiaries trained in income generating activities
2.1 % of SWAPNO beneficiaries’ improved health status (self-reported: bad & good) as against baseline status 3.1 Number of SWAPNO beneficiaries have active financial accounts with digital financial service providers; 3.2 % of SWAPNO beneficiaries accessing financial services (savings & Loan) other than wage payments; 3.3 Number of women employed with formal sector employment
4.1 Number of people with access to improved economic infrastructure (roads, markets, etc.) as a result of public works completed through the project 4.2 % of rural community households having better usage of targeted public assets 4.3 Number of workers employed in project public works schemes. 4.4 Number of workdays provided in labour intensive public works schemes
5.1 Number public asset schemes serving the purpose of reducing natural disaster / climate change risk
6.1 % of 3,564 households perceiving local government institutions having transparency, capacity and responsiveness 6.2 Number of participatory meetings and exercises organized by local government institutions 6.3 Number of disadvantaged women provided with follow-up and counseling for sustainable livelihoods
